column4: does anyone know how to find and configure canon printer drivers for ubuntu?
how will i configure it?
what printer do you have/
ubuntu comes with a driver for your printer.
not quite.
You are running gnome?
System-Admin-Printing, tell it to add a new printer.
is it detected automatically?
how is it connected?
pick one or the other. I would start with 2100
if you have the foomatic-filters-ppds package installed, you will find a ppd for your printer in usr/share/ppd/Canon/Canon-BJC-2100-bjc600.ppd.gz
what have you done, and where do you see this error?
what do you use to install ubuntu packages? Synaptic or apt-get?
do you still have the New Printer dialog open?
Have you selected Local Printer and the Printer Port?
okay, when you click Forward, do you get to where you select the driver?
the one where your printer is connected, probably something like USB #1 or /dev/usblp0 or /dev/usb/lp0
there aren't that many choices.
USB #1 then (like I said above).
what error message, and where?
okay.
